fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • The UK's deficit for 2009/10 was given as £106,369,000,000 in a centrespread graphic on the spending review yesterday (pages 20-21). We should have added the information that this was the figure calculated by the Office for National Statistics for the budget deficit, excluding net investment. Adding in net investment (for schools, government projects, etc) gave a higher figure of £155.666bn, which the ONS yesterday reassessed to £156.043bn • A graphic that showed average university tuition fees around the world overestimated fees in the United States. We gave a figure of £31,400 for the US. This was based on an estimate by the OECD for a two-year course in the US. Figures for other countries in the graphic were for a single year (Heavy debts will not put students off prize of university, says Browne, 13 October, page 4). • We were wrong to say that there was no sign of David Koch, the oil and gas billionaire who has helped fund Americans for Prosperity at the group's Defending the Dream convention this year. He was at the gathering, where he presented an award (How a retiring pair of Big Oil billionaires helped a grassroots insurgency to grow, 14 October, page 25).
